text: [music playing]

INTERVIEWER: President Reagan,
how do you think your successor
is doing in his first 100 days?

There seems to be some
discussion about that.

PRESIDENT REAGAN: Well, I'm
not a part of that discussion

because I think he's
doing just fine.

CHARLES BIERBAUER: George
Bush shrugs off complaints
that is pace is too slow.

WOLF BLITZER: The White House
did not stage any special event

for President
Clinton today to mark
this one 100th day in office.

But the president still
found a way to once
again defend his record.

BILL CLINTON: I don't that 100
days is a rational category,

but if you look at
how much we've done

and how much is well underway
now as compared with the most

previous administrations
in a similar time period,
I think we're doing pretty well.

MARK SHIELDS: George
W. Bush was asked

to evaluate the first 100 days
of his presidency by John King.

GEORGE W. BUSH: The
only thing I know

to do is just to give it my
all, put my whole heart and soul
into the job.
I really like what I'm doing.
So I'm feeling pretty darn good.

- Those of you who
went to cnn.com,

what grade would you give
the President of the United
States for his first 100 days?
On average you'd give him a B.

BARACK OBAMA: So today,
on my 100 day in office,

I've come back to report to
you, the American people,

that we have begun
to pick ourselves up
and dust ourselves off.

And we've begun the work
of remaking America.
